metadata.title: CVE-2012-3825 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
Multiple integer overflows in Wireshark 1.4.x before 1.4.13 and 1.6.xbefore 1.6.8 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infiniteloop) via vectors related to the (1) BACapp and (2) Bluetooth HCIdissectors, a different vulnerability than CVE-2012-2392.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-3825` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.6.8-1ubuntu1
libwireshark3 - 1.6.8-1ubuntu1
libwiretap3 - 1.6.8-1ubuntu1
libwsutil3 - 1.6.8-1ubuntu1
tshark - 1.6.8-1ubuntu1
wireshark - 1.6.8-1ubuntu1
wireshark-common - 1.6.8-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.8-1ubuntu1').
